slides.originalNotes:
Rating overrides
The user cannot enter any overrides without first rating a policy. After viewing the results from a quote, the user can decide to apply overrides where permitted.

slides.originalNotes:
Review: How are costs handled in PolicyCenter?
The values BaseRate, AdjRate, Basis, ProrataFactor, TermAmount and Amount are allstored in the cost in the PolicyCenter.
slides.notes:
Review: How are costs handled in PolicyCenter?
The values BaseRate, AdjRate, Basis, ProrataFactor, TermAmount and Amount are allstored in the cost in the PolicyCenter.
slides.ocrText:
| Review: How are costs handled in PolicyCenter? i

¢ The cost is an entity in PolicyCenter

¢ The cost stores several details
related to rating a policy

« Base rate (BaseRate)

« Adjusted rate (AdjRate)

* Basis(Basis)

* Pro rata factor (ProrataFactor)
* Term amount (TermAmount)

« Amount(Amount)

slides.originalNotes:
What can you override?
Rating overrides allow you to override the base rate and adjusted rate. You can also enter the un-prorated amount for the term amount, or a enter a prorated amount to set a flat cost.  If a policy has rating overrides,  PolicyCenter creates an underwriting issue before releasing the quote. The issue must be approved before certain users, such as agents, can view the quote. This process enables the insurer to verify that overrides are properly reviewed and approved before releasing pricing information.
slides.notes:
What can you override?
Rating overrides allow you to override the base rate and adjusted rate. You can also enter the un-prorated amount for the term amount, or a enter a prorated amount to set a flat cost.  If a policy has rating overrides,  PolicyCenter creates an underwriting issue before releasing the quote. The issue must be approved before certain users, such as agents, can view the quote. This process enables the insurer to verify that overrides are properly reviewed and approved before releasing pricing information.
slides.ocrText:
| What can you override?

¢ Base rate and adjusted rate
¢ Un-prorated amount term amount
* Prorated flat cost

slides.originalNotes:
What lines of business allow rating overrides?
In the base configuration, the workers' compensation, inland marine, and commercial property lines of business (LOB) allow rating overrides. You can add rating overrides to other lines, as well
slides.notes:
What lines of business allow rating overrides?
In the base configuration, the workers' compensation, inland marine, and commercial property lines of business (LOB) allow rating overrides. You can add rating overrides to other lines, as well

| What lines of business allow rating overrides?

o,

>

commercial

workers inland marine
property

compensation

slides.originalNotes:
What cannot be overridden?
There are certain types of costs where rating overrides are not appropriate. The overrides can be disabled for these cost types. For example, you may designate that users cannot override the tax calculation. In the base application, experience modifiers and schedule credits do not allow overrides since the user directly enters values when they are editing the policy.
slides.notes:
What cannot be overridden?

slides.originalNotes:
Costs and rating overrides (developers)
Each set of data includes:

Base Rate — rate found from rate table lookup

Adjusted Rate — rate derived from base rate adjusted for factors such as applied deductible or taxes

Term Amount — Premium or cost used for a full policy term

Amount — Term amount adjusted for the effective period

The user cannot enter any overrides without first rating a policy. After viewing the results from a quote, they overrides can be applied where permitted.

| Rating overrides across policy transactions Gi

¢ Rating overrides can be entered in
any PolicyCenter jobs, set for a policy
period and preserved for future jobs

* Overrides are not preserved during:

egR

+ Reinstatement: when overridden costs
occur after a cancellation date

+ Rewrite: If the overridden costs are
effective after or before the copied date

« Renewal: Overrides from a previous
policy term are copied to the renewal job
and a referral reason is created for an
underwriter, who decides if the override
continues
